  • Flask exposes EV data and calculations as JSON
  • Django consumes the API and renders HTML pages

3. Flask API Responsibilities

  • Provide EV car data
  • Calculate trip feasibility
  • Return JSON responses

Example Endpoint

GET /api/cars
GET /api/cars/<id>
GET /api/range-check?car_id=1&trip_km=120

4. Django Responsibilities

  • Render UI pages
  • Handle user input (forms)
  • Call Flask API using requests

Example Django View

def car_list(request):
    r = requests.get("http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/cars")
    cars = r.json()
    return render(request, "cars/car_list.html", {"cars": cars})

5. Car List Page

Displays:

  • EV brand and model
  • Battery percentage
  • Estimated range

6. Range Check Feature

Users enter trip distance in kilometers. The system checks if the selected EV can complete the trip.

Logic

  • User enters distance
  • Django sends request to Flask
  • Flask compares range vs trip
if trip_km <= car_range:
    return "Trip possible"
else:
    return "Charging required"

7. Car Comparison Feature

Users can compare two EVs based on:

  • Battery capacity
  • Range
  • Trip feasibility

Compare Page URL

/compare/
